VLIB Function Reference

Gradient 5x5 Pyramid Kernel

Introduction and Use Cases

Gradient image pyramid is a data structure consisting of the original image at level 0, 2x2 sub-sampled gradient images at Level 1, further 2x2 sub-sampled gradient images at Level 2, etc. It is commonly used in detection and tracking, as well as in image fusion applications, in order to reduce the amount of processing [1].

Specification

Function

The two functions for gradient pyramid are used for horizontal and vertical gradient filtering, respectively. These functions can be used to calculate the next level of a pyramid. Given a pointer to a rectangular region of interest described by W (input data width), P (input data pitch), and H (input data height), each of these kernels returns (W-4)/2 x (H-3)/2 values. For example, if H=5, each will calculate a single row of results. The filters used at each step are: 

            -1  -2  0   2   1
            -4  -8  0   8   4
    H5 =    -6  -12 0   12  6   (horizontal)
            -4  -8  0   8   4
            -1  -2  0   2   1

            -1  -4  -6  -4  -1
            -2  -8  -12 -8  -2
    V5  =   0   0   0   0   0   (vertical)
            2   8   12  8   2
            1   4   6   4   1
After the filtering step, the intermediate results are rounded and scaled to values 0-255 (the output value of 128 indicates no gradient) as shown in the following equations: 

        Gh = ((conv2(A,H5) + 64) >> 7) + 128;
        Gv = ((conv2(A,V5) + 64) >> 7) + 128;

Inputs


    Parameter          Description
    ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    *pIn               Input image                                (UQ8.0)
    *pB                5 x (width-4) temporary array              (UQ16.0)
     width             Input width                                (UQ16.0)
     pitch             Pitch of the input image                   (UQ16.0)
     height            Input height                               (UQ16.0)
    *pOut              Output image                               (UQ8.0)

Outputs

    Returns VLIB Error Status

Method

The value of cols = W-4 must be a multiple of 8, rows = H (height of the input data) must be > 4
